name: Skeleton
description: An animated skeleton stripped of flesh, wielding old weapons and armor.
memorable: Undead soldier serving loyal to its summoner, attacking without fear.
goals: Typically found as guardians or disposable soldiers for necromancers.
relations: Commonly related to necromancers and similar undead creatures.
environment: Ancient tombs, crypts, or areas under necromantic control.
strengths: Good agility with high Dexterity, resilient to many conditions.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to bludgeoning damage, low intelligence and social skills.
attacks: Uses a Shortsword for melee and a Shortbow for ranged attacks.
most_powerful_ability: Counterattack: strikes back when hit, potentially dealing more damage.
equipment: Wears scraps of old armor and wields remnants of previous weapons.
senses: Immunity to exhaustion and poison, does not require air, food, or sleep.
skills: Very limited problem-solving ability due to low Intelligence score.
additional_information: Can use False Appearance to ambush enemies.
Relies on its Undead Nature to operate without fatigue.
Commonly encountered as low-level foes in D&D.
Tactical advantage in combat environments due to mindless actions.
Serves as an archetypal undead enemy.
test_queries: animation of dead bodies as soldiers
